response:
The 300 g bag contains 5 servings, so each serving is \(300\,\text{g} ÷ 5 = 60\,\text{g}\).  
Each serving has 250 calories, giving a calorie‑to‑weight ratio of  

\[
\frac{250 \text{ cal}}{60 \text{ g}} \approx 4.17 \text{ cal/g}.
\]

You can consume only \(2000 - 1800 = 200\) calories today.  
The weight of chips that fits within 200 calories is

\[
\text{grams} = \frac{200 \text{ cal}}{4.17 \text{ cal/g}} \approx 48 \text{ g}.
\]

**Answer: 48 grams**  

#### 48
